definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: Head up and prevent accidents do pancake.
sentences.chinese: 低头做烧饼，抬头防意外。

sentences.english: She ate two shao-pings a day and she cut corners in other way.
sentences.chinese: 她每天吃两个烧饼，并采取其他方法节省开支。

sentences.english: I have installed two sesame seed holding a small plastic bag while and enjoy the scenery while strolling.
sentences.chinese: 我拿着装了两个烧饼的小塑料袋边观赏美景边溜达。

sentences.english: Got to class and my douchebag professor gave me an F.
sentences.chinese: 到了班里的时候我发现我的烧饼教授给了我个不及格。

sentences.english: Hello , can I help you with the pancakes? Yes , please.
sentences.chinese: 你们好，要我帮你们做薄烧饼吗？好啊，请吧。

sentences.english: You want to treat me to pita bread?
Hello , can I help you with the pancakes?
sentences.chinese: 你们好，要我帮你们做薄烧饼吗？

definition: jianbing, a savory Chinese crêpe/pancake/CL:張|张[zhang1]
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒賣|烧卖[shao1 mai4]
lit. meat wedged in steamed bun/"Chinese burger"/sliced meat sandwich popular in north China
wonton/see also 餛飩|馄饨[hun2 tun5]
